Hitarth Parikh, a recent graduate of GLS-ID, has founded a sports tech startup called Hyperlab with the help of the faculty of GLSS-ID and Studio Carbon. The startup aims to create cutting-edge technologies for sports training and rehabilitation, with its flagship product, Helios, being a virtual target projection equipment designed to improve athletes' courtcraft, footwork, reflexes, and agility. The product offers an engaging and gamified training experience while monitoring important athlete data.The startup started with two and now its a team 14 skilled individual. Hyperlab has patented the product in India and filed for patent in the USA, Europe, and Australia. The company has also received a grant of 45 lakhs from the Gujarat government for product development, and its mission is to make sports technology accessible to athletes of all levels.
